00008 """A tiny web server.
00009 
00010 This is intended to be used for testing, and
00011 only run from within the
00012 examples directory.
00013 """
00014 
00015 import BaseHTTPServer
00016 import logging
00017 import os
00018 import SimpleHTTPServer
00019 import SocketServer
00020 import sys
00021 import urlparse
00022 
00023 logging.getLogger().setLevel(logging.INFO)
00024 
00025 # Using 'localhost' means that we only accept connections
00026 # via the loop back interface.
00027 SERVER_PORT = 5103
00028 SERVER_HOST = ''
00029 
00030 # We only run from the examples directory (the one that contains scons-out), so
00031 # that not too much is exposed via this HTTP server.  Everything in the
00032 # directory is served, so there should never be anything potentially sensitive
00033 # in the serving directory, especially if the machine might be a
00034 # multi-user machine and not all users are trusted.  We only serve via
00035 # the loopback interface.
00036 
00037 SAFE_DIR_COMPONENTS = ['nacl']
00038 SAFE_DIR_SUFFIX = apply(os.path.join, SAFE_DIR_COMPONENTS)
00039 
00040 def SanityCheckDirectory():
00041   #if os.getcwd().endswith(SAFE_DIR_SUFFIX):
00042   return
00043   logging.error('httpd.py should only be run from the %s', SAFE_DIR_SUFFIX)
00044   logging.error('directory for testing purposes.')
00045   logging.error('We are currently in %s', os.getcwd())
00046   sys.exit(1)
00047 
00048 
00049 # An HTTP server that will quit when |is_running| is set to False.
00050 class QuittableHTTPServer(BaseHTTPServer.HTTPServer):
00051   def serve_forever(self):
00052     self.is_running = True
00053     while self.is_running:
00054       self.handle_request()
00055 
00056   def shutdown(self):
00057     self.is_running = False
00058     return 1
00059 
00060 
00061 # "Safely" split a string at |sep| into a [key, value] pair.  If |sep| does not
00062 # exist in |str|, then the entire |str| is the key and the value is set to an
00063 # empty string.
00064 def KeyValuePair(str, sep='='):
00065   if sep in str:
00066     return str.split(sep)
00067   else:
00068     return [str, '']
00069 
00070 
00071 # A small handler that looks for '?quit=1' query in the path and shuts itself
00072 # down if it finds that parameter.
00073 class QuittableHTTPHandler(SimpleHTTPServer.SimpleHTTPRequestHandler):
00074   def do_GET(self):
00075     (_, _, _, query, _) = urlparse.urlsplit(self.path)
00076     url_params = dict([KeyValuePair(key_value)
00077                       for key_value in query.split('&')])
00078     if 'quit' in url_params and '1' in url_params['quit']:
00079       self.send_response(200, 'OK')
00080       self.send_header('Content-type', 'text/html')
00081       self.send_header('Content-length', '0')
00082       self.end_headers()
00083       self.server.shutdown()
00084       return
00085 
00086     SimpleHTTPServer.SimpleHTTPRequestHandler.do_GET(self)
00087 
00088 
00089 def Run(server_address,
00090         server_class=QuittableHTTPServer,
00091         handler_class=QuittableHTTPHandler):
00092   httpd = server_class(server_address, handler_class)
00093   logging.info("Starting local server on port %d", server_address[1])
00094   logging.info("To shut down send http://localhost:%d?quit=1",
00095                server_address[1])
00096   httpd.serve_forever()
00097   logging.info("Shutting down local server on port %d", server_address[1])
00098 
00099 
00100 if __name__ == '__main__':
00101   SanityCheckDirectory()
00102   if len(sys.argv) > 1:
00103     Run((SERVER_HOST, int(sys.argv[1])))
00104   else:
00105     Run((SERVER_HOST, SERVER_PORT))
00106   sys.exit(0)
